pLaunchControl

Class LaunchController

  • java.lang.Object
    • pLaunchControl.LaunchControl

  • public class LaunchController
extends java.lang.Object
    A wrapper for the MIDI controller Novation LaunchControl.
    After instantiating a LaunchController, you can use the following events (*) to track changes to knobs and pads:

    void launchControllerChanged() is triggered when either a knob or a pad has changed. This event does not provide additional information of which knob or pad has changed.

    void launchControllerKnobChanged(KNOBS knob) is trigger when a knob has changed. The parameter knob will have the value of which knob was changed.

    void launchControllerPadChanged(PADS pad) is triggered when a pad has switched states. The parameter pad will have the value of which pad was changed.
    (*) In Processing, simply add a new method with the names and parameters as above.

      • getKnob

        public Knob getKnob(KNOBS knob)
        Returns the Knob object for one of the knobs in the controller.
        Parameters:
        knob -
        Returns:
        A Knob object corresponding to the physical knob.

      • setKnobPosition

        public void setKnobPosition(KNOBS knob,
                            int position)

      • setKnobValueRange

        public void setKnobValueRange(float knob_min,
                              float knob_max)
        Sets the range of the output of the all controller knobs. By default, the knobs range from 0-127. Call `setKnobValueRange` to make the knobs values fluctuate in another range, for example to match RGB range from 0-255.
        Parameters:
        knob_min - The value to return when knobs are in the left-most position.
        knob_max - The value to return when knobs are in the right-most position.

      • getPad

        public boolean getPad(PADS pad)
        The status of a given PADS as a boolean value. Alternative, you can get the status of a pad a int value with getPadInt(PADS)
        Parameters:
        pad - The pad to check.
        Returns:
        True if the pad is "on", False otherwise.

      • getPadInt

        public int getPadInt(PADS pad)
        The status of a given pad as int value.
        Parameters:
        pad - The pad to check.
        Returns:
        1 if the pad is on, 0 otherwise.

        public void setPadMode(PADMODE padMode)

        Parameters:
